paper_abstract: Given a set of n elements, each of which is colored one of c colors, we must determine an element of the plurality (most frequently occurring) color by pairwise equal/unequal color comparisons of elements. We prove that (c - 1)(n - c)/2 color comparisons are necessary in the worst case to determine the plurality color and give an algorithm requiring (0.775c + 5.9)n + O(c(2)) color comparisons for c >= 9.
